definition: minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: That is, if you are one of these commune communities, then you're just a small number of people.
sentences.chinese: 即使是公社，集结成的也只是个小众团体。

sentences.english: The three foreign exhibitors are all niche brands.
sentences.chinese: 三家国外展商都是小众品牌。

sentences.english: The other two are mass entertainment and niche programming.
sentences.chinese: 另外两个战略是大众娱乐和小众节目。

sentences.english: Part six: a small minority experience strategy book.
sentences.chinese: 第六部分，小众书体验型战略。

sentences.english: The company targets the niche consumers who want luxury electric vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 特斯拉的目标客户是想买豪华电动汽车的小众消费者。

definition: a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition
the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
petit bourgeois/yuppie/abbr. of 小資產階級|小资产阶级
